title: fanoutqa: When were the top 5 most translated authors born? (c0ca99cbbb908c7d)

chat_history.content:
<document>
<title>List of most translated individual authors</title>
<content>
This page provides **list of most translated individual authors** to date sorted by the total number of translations.[1]



This is a dynamic list and may never be able to satisfy particular standards for completeness. You can help by adding missing items with reliable sources.

As of August 2017[update]





| Rank
 | Author
 | Nationality
 | Original language
 | Target languages
 | Ttl. no. of translations
 |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| 1 | Agatha Christie | ![United Kingdom](image) | English | 103[2] | 7,236[3] |
| 2 | Jules Verne | ![](image) | French | — | 4,751[3] |
| 3 | William Shakespeare | ![](image) | English | — | 4,296[3] |
| 4 | Enid Blyton | ![United Kingdom](image) | English | 90[4] | 3,924[3] |
| 5 | Barbara Cartland | ![United Kingdom](image) | English | 38[5] | 3,652[3] |
| 6 | Danielle Steel | ![United States](image) | English | 43[6] | 3,628[3] |
| 7 | Vladimir Lenin | ![](image) | Russian | — | 3,593[3] |
| 8 | Hans Christian Andersen | ![Denmark](image) | Danish | — | 3,520[3] |
| 9 | Stephen King | ![United States](image) | English | — | 3,357[3] |
| 10 | Philipp Winterberg | ![Germany](image) | German | 160[7] | 3,329[8] |
| 11 | Jacob Grimm | ![](image) | German | — | 2,977[3] |
| 12 | Wilhelm Grimm | ![](image) | German | — | 2,951[3] |
| 13 | Nora Roberts | ![United States](image) | English | — | 2,597[3] |
| 14 | Alexandre Dumas | ![France](image) | French | 100 | 2,540[3] |
| 15 | Arthur Conan Doyle | ![United Kingdom](image) | English | — | 2,496[3] |
| 16 | Mark Twain | ![United States](image) | English | — | 2,431[3] |
| 17 | Fyodor Dostoyevsky | ![](image) | Russian | 170[9] | 2,342[3] |
| 18 | Georges Simenon | ![Belgium](image) | French | — | 2,315[3] |
| 19 | Astrid Lindgren | ![Sweden](image) | Swedish | 60–95 | 2,271[3] |
| 20 | Pope John Paul II | ![](image) | — | — | 2,258[3] |
| 21 | René Goscinny | ![France](image) | French | — | 2,234[3] |
| 22 | R. L. Stine | ![United States](image) | English | — | 2,222[3] |
| 23 | Jack London | ![United States](image) | English | — | 2,182[3] |
| 24 | Leo Tolstoy | ![](image) | Russian | — | 2,178[3] |
| 25 | Isaac Asimov | ![United States](image) | English | — | 2,159[3] |
| 26 | Charles Dickens | ![United Kingdom](image) | English | — | 2,112[3] |


  




## See also[edit]


* List of literary works by number of translations
* List of best-selling fiction authors
* Index Translationum


## References[edit]


1. **^** "The Top 10 Most Translated Authors of All Time". *Ulatus.com*. Archived from the original on 29 April 2020.
2. **^** McWhirter, Norris; McWhirter, Ross (1976). *Guinness Book of World Records, 11th U.S. Edition*. Bantam Books. p. 704.
3. ^ ***a*** ***b*** ***c*** ***d*** ***e*** ***f*** ***g*** ***h*** ***i*** ***j*** ***k*** ***l*** ***m*** ***n*** ***o*** ***p*** ***q*** ***r*** ***s*** ***t*** ***u*** ***v*** ***w*** ***x*** ***y*** UNESCO Statistics. "Index Translationum - "TOP 50000" Author". *Official website of UNESCO*. United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization (UNESCO). Retrieved 11 August 2017.
4. **^** Clark, Nick (27 March 2012). "Seven go on a 21-century adventure: Enid Blyton classics to be rewritten". *The Independent*. Retrieved 12 August 2017. Blyton's works have been translated into 90 languages.
5. **^** McCorquodale, Ian (2017). "Welcome to the romantic world of Barbara Cartland". *BarbaraCartland.com*. Archived from the original on 12 August 2017. Retrieved 12 August 2017. During her long career, my mother, Barbara Cartland wrote an incredible 723 books, which were translated into 38 languages, making her the most prolific author of the 20th Century.
6. **^** "About Danielle Steel". *Official website of Danielle Steel*. Retrieved 12 August 2017. She is published in 69 countries and 43 languages.
7. **^** "Katalog der Deutschen Nationalbibliothek". *portal.dnb.de*.
8. **^** "Katalog der Deutschen Nationalbibliothek". *portal.dnb.de*.
9. **^** Kjetsaa, Geir (1989). *Fyodor Dostoyevsky: A Writer's Life*. Fawcett Columbine. p. foreword. ISBN 978-0-449-90334-6.

</content>
</document>

functions.name: delegate
functions.desc:
Ask a capable helper for help looking up a piece of information or performing an action.
Do not simply repeat what the user said as instructions.
You should use this to break up complex user queries into multiple simpler steps.
NOTE: Helpers cannot see previous parts of your conversation.

instructions.description: Detailed instructions on what your helper should do to help you.

functions.name: search
functions.desc: Search Wikipedia for an article with the given title, and get its content. If no such article is found, return similar article names.
